description: From French chicanerie (“trickery”), from chicaner, borrowed from Middle Low German schicken, ultimately from Proto-West Germanic *skikkijan, from Proto-Germanic *skikkijaną. Related to German schicken (“to send, ship”), Middle English skekken (“to send forth, issue”).

entries.meaning: Deception by use of trickery, quibbling, or subterfuge.
(countable, law) A slick performance by a lawyer.
